title: Can we have green wards back?
body:
I think there's been enough experimentation with new vision, and while I like the new trinkets and all, the lack of green wards when it comes to mid game and later is pretty heinous.
It punishes good players that try to control vision and doesn't really affect the bad ones that never bought them to begin with.
It doesn't help that yellow trinket is a shadow of its former self.

Top and Mid are also terrible now because you can't even ward efficiently for ganks. You can drop ONE pink (Whose idea was this?) and it's visible to the jungler who is now going to kill it, cost you 75 gold, then stick around anyway.
Sure, combine it with yellow trinket, but those wards don't last for shit, so they are pretty pointless at certain points in the game.

At the very least, we should have greens back with a limit of 1-2 per person. It's just stupid not having them in the game anymore.

replies.body: Im a simple man when i see "bring back green wards" i upvote.

The reasons for removing green wards were good. It was a way to snowball game, where the winning team could afford more wards than the losing team, and win even more thanks to that.

Also, yellow trinket is currently buffed on the PBE. -30s recharge time at level 18. It's noticeably better.

How is this different than other types of wards? I could say the exact same thing about vision (pink) wards. If the enemy team is ahead, they're going to have more vision. So how do we fix this problem without removing wards?

It's easy to remove pink wards and each player can only have one. It's not easy to remove green wards, you need to guess it's here + have an Oracle source, and each player can have 3. So the problem is much more important with green than with pink.
nice comeback. he didn't think it through
I feel sarcasm.
no it was honest.
Oh... Thanks, I suppose.

That's a bad argument because in the previous season the losing team could still just buy a yellow trinket and have 100% uptime on their wards, just like the winning team. Buying more green wards does very little because you can still only have 3 out at once.

The real reason they did it is just because they wanted less vision in the game in general.

You can't buy yellow trinket before level 9. If you get an early kill level 4 or 5, you can buy 1 or 2 green wards and put them deep in their jungle, and use that to get YET another early kill. That's what the guys at higher ELO where doing. And at lower ELO, they just didn't bought ward ever, so nothing has changed for them.

Now you can't do that, NOW the situation is really symmetrical for both teams, not before. And you can't do with pink wards what you were doing with green before. Since they are visible, it's very easy to remove them and deny that deep vision to the winning team. Before you needed a red trinket and a good instinct, and that meant even less wards for you since you had no yellow trinket.

Not to mention the winning team just all gets red trinkets and sweeps out your vision since they don't have to rely on yellow trinkets as much. The game has far less vision snowball currently. However, in the lower levels of play (like Silver for me) it punishes players like me who tend to invest in vision. I still buy pinks but it just doesn't feel the same as a jungler or top laner. Just can't seem to get the same vision coverage as I used to.
yeah, it's the "middle ELO" effect I was mentioning in another comment. But I wonder what fraction of players are actually affected. I'd like to have some internal data from Riot :p

This is completely wrong. The way wards right now benefit the team ahead as you need wards the MOST when you're behind thus need to play more defensively and stay safe, but with how wards are you need to protect them because blue trinket/purples are the only reliable wards but they aren't invisible and will constantly get killed. If you're behind you can't really fight the enemy or contest the wards so the  team behind will almost never have vision while the team ahead constantly has vision which creates a snowball effect.

But if you are behind, you shouldn't try to fight, because you will lose, since you are behind. You should stay under your turret and wait and farm until you catch-up.

What you describe is still true today. But it was EVEN WORSE before, with green wards. Today, the losing team has no vision, it's true, but they didn't have vision before either! And before, the winning team had much more vision, whereas now, it's easier for the losing team to remove winning team's vision.

Being an ADC main I really hate the removal of green wards. ADCs rely so much on vision to stay safe and to be able to farm, without green wards all we have is a pink ward and the blue ward to try to light up the map and protect ourselves from assassins. Most of the time without my support following me the entire game I just have to wait under turret to farm or hope that my team decides to set up wards around the area I am farming in.

Green ward removal in general has decreased my enjoyment of the game and my winrate has noticeably decreased and while obviously a lot of big changes have happened during preseason I feel like the changing of wards has had the biggest negative impact on my winrate as I adapted to abusing vision and really enjoyed it as well.

I don't know why you get downvoted, this is actually a very relevant answer...

2. It's true that the arguments given by Riot in order to justify removing them are especially true at higher ELO.

The only objection I can see is: is there a noticeable "middle ELO" where the situation is sensibly worse than before.

From memory, the old Red Post you mention was about how Sightstone not recharging with time was a conscious decision, because it's usually the only way to force Support going back to base, and this was needed to create opportunities for the opposing team (especially for the losing side).

Your point about Support needing item is not false, but they get much less gold than other classes, so they need to back less often, and their kits are designed to be effective even without items, so it's less a problem if they sit on a large pile of cash

Moreover, if really as a support you feel forced to get back to base to get item, you shouldn't need a recharging Sightstone, since you recharge it already when you do back. You're saying at the same time "I don't want to have to back" and "You don't need to force me to back, I already do it." It's not consistent.

Or you are backing only for recharging your sightstone, you would need the auto-recharge, but Riot "excuse" isn't silly.

I hate how as the jungler, if I don't take green smite, I have to rely on my team to ward properly with the already underwhelming yellow trinket if I want a sweeper. I'm almost tempted to build a sightstone just so I can have better vision control, but 800 gold is a pretty big investment in terms of delaying items for a jungler.

Vision shouldn't be about how many wards you can spam. It should be about having them in the places you need them to set up objective play. They should be used to help secure dragons, secure barons, set up for jungle invades, or scout for enemy roamers on the side of the map. If you're an ADC and you use your blue trinket up ahead in the lane to stay safe, place a 75 gold pink ward closer to you. You should be watching your mini map anyway and someone destroying your ward gives you all the knowledge of where they are that you need to make an intelligent decision about getting to a safer place.

Also, your towers are still your friends. Use them intelligently. You shouldn't be pushing very far past your furthest tower to begin with. If you have only Inhibitor turrets up, you shouldn't be pushing your farm out to the river. You're just asking for death. Wards shouldn't be a crutch you use for bad in-game decisions. They should be used more strategically.

And all this crying about the ward rubble is a bit disappointing. When I see that there are 3 ward rubble in the tri-brush on the top side, I see that as a sign that I need to be careful what kind of pathing I use to gank top. Obviously, that opponent is very serious about his warding and wants to keep himself safe. It's a good, useful tool to tell what kind of good decisions you can make based off of how your opponent is playing. Plus, when I get my sweeper rolling, I know the danger spots to where I should be sweeping to make sure I can make an effective play. Predictable opponents can be complacent opponents and make for some easy plays if you let the situations (and the clues) reveal themselves.

lack of green wards is way more punishing when behind than when ahead, ahead you can use for picks, but behind you have to rely on fairly minimalist wards to deal with a game that has fundamentally changed because the amount of gold in the game at most points is higher.
I think things would be fine if sightstone upgrades would just recharge over time without having to back constantly.
